first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah
first_reading.text:
[[Is 49,1]]Hear me, O islands, listen, O distant peoples. The Lord called me from birth, from my mother's womb he gave me my name.
[[Is 49,2]]He made of me a sharp-edged sword and concealed me in the shadow of his arm. He made me a polished arrow, in his quiver he hid me.
[[Is 49,3]]You are my servant, he said to me, Israel, through whom I show my glory.
[[Is 49,4]]Though I thought I had toiled in vain, and for nothing, uselessly, spent my strength, Yet my reward is with the LORD, my recompense is with my God.
[[Is 49,5]]For now the LORD has spoken who formed me as his servant from the womb, That Jacob may be brought back to him and Israel gathered to him; And I am made glorious in the sight of the LORD, and my God is now my strength!
[[Is 49,6]]It is too little, he says, for you to be my servant, to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and restore the survivors of Israel; I will make you a light to the nations, that my salvation may reach to the ends of the earth.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 71,1]]In you, LORD, I take refuge; 
let me never be put to shame.
[[Ps 71,2]]In your justice rescue and deliver me; 
incline your ear to me, and save me.

[[Ps 71,3]]Be my rock of refuge, 
a stronghold to give me safety, 
for you are my rock and my fortress.
[[Ps 71,4a]]O my God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked.

[[Ps 71,5]]For you are my hope, O Lord; 
my trust, O God, from my youth.
[[Ps 71,6a]]On you I depend from birth;
[[Ps 71,6b]]from my mother's womb you are my strength.

[[Ps 71,15]]My mouth shall declare your justice, 
day by day your salvation.
[[Ps 71,17]]O God, you have taught me from my youth, 
and till the present I proclaim your wondrous deeds.

gospel.text:
[[Jn 13,21]]Reclining at table with his disciples, Jesus was deeply troubled and testified, «Amen, amen, I say to you, one of you will betray me.»
[[Jn 13,22]]The disciples looked at one another, at a loss as to whom he meant.
[[Jn 13,23]]One of his disciples, the one whom Jesus loved, was reclining at Jesus' side.
[[Jn 13,24]]So Simon Peter nodded to him to find out whom he meant.
[[Jn 13,25]]He leaned back against Jesus' chest and said to him, "Master, who is it?"
[[Jn 13,26]]Jesus answered, "It is the one to whom I hand the morsel after I have dipped it." So he dipped the morsel and (took it and) handed it to Judas, son of Simon the Iscariot.
[[Jn 13,27]]After he took the morsel, Satan entered him. So Jesus said to him, "What you are going to do, do quickly."
[[Jn 13,28]](Now) none of those reclining at table realized why he said this to him.
[[Jn 13,29]]Some thought that since Judas kept the money bag, Jesus had told him, "Buy what we need for the feast," or to give something to the poor.
[[Jn 13,30]]So he took the morsel and left at once. And it was night.
[[Jn 13,31]]When Judas had left them, Jesus said, "Now is the Son of Man glorified, and God is glorified in him.
[[Jn 13,32]](If God is glorified in him,) God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him at once.
[[Jn 13,33]]My children, I will be with you only a little while longer. You will look for me, and as I told the Jews, 'Where I go you cannot come,' so now I say it to you.
[[Jn 13,36]]Simon Peter said to him, "Master, where are you going?" Jesus answered (him), "Where I am going, you cannot follow me now, though you will follow later."
[[Jn 13,37]]Peter said to him, "Master, why can't I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you."
[[Jn 13,38]]Jesus answered, "Will you lay down your life for me? Amen, amen, I say to you, the cock will not crow before you deny me three times."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
